items.content:
Head of Engineering
Ideally located in London, Berlin or Amsterdam (open to other locations)

At Snowplow, we are on a mission to empower people to differentiate with data. We provide both the technology and services to enable our customers to not only take control of their data, but allow them to do amazing things with that control.
As part of that effort, we're changing the way that people do digital analytics by moving companies away from a one-size-fits-all mindset and enabling them to collect and own their data themselves.

The Opportunity
Following rapid company growth over the last 12 months, we’re now looking for a Head of Engineering to join us and lead, guide & support our fully-remote engineering team through the next phases of growth. Though the team is still relatively small, they’re already dealing with hugely complex challenges spanning across product, data engineering, cloud architecture, automation and much more.

The role will comprise of 3 key parts:

People Management
We have a talented & diverse team of engineers - it will be your job to coach & mentor them, to ensure their personal development is being looked after and to continue to hire people that are not only strong technically, but also closely align with our company culture (wherever they may be located).

Growth
Snowplow’s growth plans are ambitious and a large part of the role will be focused around scaling the technology and coming up with creative ways to overcome obstacles. Our Head of Engineering should be at the forefront of technical innovation, able to prioritise with ease and confident making difficult decisions. We’re looking for someone forward-thinking, who is able to deliver great results now, while also looking ahead at the next hurdle.

Technical Excellence
We want to build the possible product and in order to do so, we require technical expertise. We expect our Head of Engineering to do things right and to instil this in the entire team. Best practices, consistent performance and outstanding delivery.

The role is unique, the challenges are complex and the team is diverse. We’re looking for someone who takes all of this and is excited about solving those challenges, and continuing to build a high-performing engineering team at Snowplow.

Things you’ll be doing:
Own and operate the Agile processes that we are running
Conduct regular 1:1s, champion personal development and hire awesome talent
Focus on automation and scaling our current technology
Hold the team to high standards and deliver outstanding results
Work closely with Product & Engineering to shape how our product is being developed, delivered & refined
Improve efficiency & stability
Lead with authority, positivity and by example

We’d love to hear from you if:
You have experience of working in an engineering management or leadership position looking after multiple squads
You have worked with remote teams and are comfortable heading up a geographically distributed team
You have a background in one or more of the following:
- Building SaaS & Web Apps
- Data Engineering
- Microservices or Cloud Architecture
You exude technical leadership & authoritativeness while also fostering an environment of openness & respect
The idea of growing an engineering team in a fast-paced startup excites you
You have experience scaling technology
You inspire and motivate those around you
You’re confident making difficult decisions and navigating change

What you’ll get in return:
A competitive package, including share options
25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
Freedom to work wherever suits you best
Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in a different European city each year (the last one was in Milan in May 2018)
Work alongside a supportive and talented team
Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation
MacBook Pro
Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee
Improve your existing skills or mentor more junior developers in our Software Development Guild
Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
Continuous supply of Pact coffee

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
London-based startup Agenda.Video is looking for a super talented Business Development Manager with good knowledge of the real estate market. A great opportunity to join an international team that will change the market.

About the company:
“Video is a megatrend” (Mark Zuckerberg) and videos are taking over internet. Businesses marketing on the web will either embrace videos or be disrupted. Agenda.Video produces effective internet videos cheaper and faster than anyone else, operates a network of trained video editors – a “Uber for videos”. We are now looking for a talented Business Development Executive to promote our video offering among the estate agents, and thus transform the real estate industry.

Some of the things we’d like you to do:

– Build relationships with marketing decision makers in estate agents
– Convince them to use videos for their property ads to accelerate sales and lettings
– Understand current and future marketing needs of the estate agents to optimise and improve Agenda.Video offering

A bit about yourself:
– Successful experience (2-5 years) with an established estate agent
– Open-minded, out-of-the-box thinking
– Strong motivation and initiative
– Ability to network, build relationships with potential customers and close sales

What you can expect from Agenda.Video:
- OTE: £ 30.000 - 80.000 per year
30.000 base + a good commission on sales
– Remote working
– Flexible working hours
– Exciting international colleagues and clients
– European corporate culture based on values and feedback
– Opportunity to participate and grow with a great startup that will change the industry

items.title: Head of Content
items.content:
Head of Content

Location: Remote Moscow
Role and job type: ️ Content Full-time

Job Description

Akropolis is looking for a talented Content Writer with fintech, asset management and social impact experience who is an excellent communicator and strategic thinker. You’ll be working with our team to create compelling content, blogs, newsletters on subject matters such as blockchain, pensions, fintech. The content writer along with our marketing team will create, edit and pitch Akropolis and related industry content across various media channels. This position requires a high level of creativity, as well as the ability to use data-driven insights and your research abilities to write relevant material.

Akropolis has grown rapidly over the past few months and we are looking for someone to help us expand our digital footprint and drive more value through online engagement by enhancing our written content and develop new content for this exciting market. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in producing material which promotes user engagement and helps to expand communities.

Daily Operations:

  • Strategic planning of the company’s content unit;
  • Produce various content types, including newsletters, social media posts, blogs and pitch articles to the relevant third-party platforms;
  • Edit content produced by other members of the team;
  • Research industry-related topics (combining online sources, interviews and case studies);
  • Coordinate with marketing and design teams to illustrate and enrich content;
  • Promote content across channels while ensuring all-around consistency (style, fonts and images);
  • Prepare periodic well-structured newsletter drafts;

Previous experience/skills:

  • Excellent english writing skills across multiple written mediums, journalists preferred;
  • Proven track record of content writing, please include links to content you worked on when you apply;
  • Worked in asset management,pensions and social impact sectors;
  • Previous experience producing online content across different channels;
  • You are a well organised creative thinker who is comfortable working both independently and in a team environment to meet tight deadlines;
  • A strong interest in technology and start ups preferably in the blockchain & crypto space;
  • Equally Comfortable working within a team and independently;
  • Previous experience in a fintech and blockchain context is a big advantage.

What we offer:

  • Working with an international team of world-class professionals with experience in finance, pension, blockchain and crypto industries;
  • A fulfilling, challenging and flexible work experience;
  • Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • You can work remotely or from our office in Moscow;
  • Practically unlimited professional and career growth opportunities.

Salary range

Competitive

items.title: Project Manager
items.content:
Project Manager

Location: Remote Moscow
Role and job type: Full-time

Job Description

Akropolis is looking for a superstar Project Manager who will help us organize the workflows for both technical development and marketing communications. The Project Manager will be organizing and overseeing the processes inside the company and will be making sure that all tasks are properly set and done. This position requires a high level of organizational skills, as well as good interpersonal communication skills.

Akropolis has grown rapidly over the past few months and we are looking for someone to help us improve our processes. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in managing blockchain projects.

Daily Operations:

  • Coordinating all processes inside the company;
  • Control performance and deliveries on the project;
  • Management of in-house and freelance specialists to get best possible result in tight schedule;
  • Setting tasks in our project management tools and control the completion;
  • Reporting on performance and optimizations.

Previous experience/skills:

  • 3+ years experience in project management;
  • Managing various sub-teams (programmers, designers, marketers, BDMs) in one project or program;
  • Experience of work on all project phases (from idea to release), adjusting methodologies depending on the project’s phase and team’s size;
  • 1+ year of experience of work in international team;

  • Excellent organizational and communication skills, result-oriented approach;
  • Experience in blockchain projects;
  • Knowledge of cryptocurrencies and ICO field;
  • Fluent spoken and excellent written English.

What we offer:

  • Working with an international team of world-class professionals with experience in finance, pension, blockchain and crypto industries;
  • A fulfilling, challenging and flexible work experience;
  • Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • You can work remotely or from our office in Moscow;
  • Practically unlimited professional and career growth opportunities.

Salary range

Competitive

items.content:
*Role Summary*

We have an exciting opportunity for a sales professional to join our team. Your role will be working as a valuable member of our sales team managing relationships with our amazing partner accounting firms.

We're growing at an incredible rate and generating huge growth in the accounting channel. This is a perfect time to join Chaser and make an instant impact and contribution to the company's success.

Chaser Account Managers are at the heart of our sales and customer service offering. Taking a consultative approach to form strong relationships with our accounting partners, assisting and guiding them with cloud strategy.

As cloud accounting adoption keeps increasing within accounting firms, you will have the unique position to help support and increase their client portfolio by adopting Chaser into their firms. You can truly help them become more efficient, add real value to their clients and help them become that go digital accounting firm they strive to become.

You'll be reporting directly to the Head of Partner Channel Sales. Our head office is located in Moorgate London; however, we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*As a person you:*

* Have highly developed communication skills and a positive demeanour
* Are consultative, process driven and persistent, with excellent professional written and verbal communication skills
* Have a proven track record in sales / account management within the B2B space (SaaS or Fintech would be great but not a requirement)
* Hard working but like to have fun and come to work with a smile on your face
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will be someone who thrives in a high speed environment
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an understanding of how best to use Chaser as a product. This will be essential for your success in the role

*What your role will consist of*

* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms
* Acting as a trusted advisor to our accounting and bookkeeping partners and supporting change management in their firms
* Educating partners to help maximise growth
* Managing and respond to incoming partner enquiries
* Monitoring all existing and prospective partners progress through the sales funnel
* Maintaining and update the CRM system of all partners staff and contact details, alongside adding new partner enquiries
* Creating and running webinars
* Providing both online and onsite demos of Chaser

*Why you'll love Chaser*

At Chaser we value our people, we want them to enjoy the job they do and provide opportunities to love and grow their career. An exciting growing company we attract people who want to help us have a positive impact by helping our partner and their clients thrive and be successful. Our passionate, innovative Chaser team strive every day to make a meaningful impact. At Chaser, we truly value the input of every single member of the team. If successful, you'll be joining a sharp, welcoming group of people who will help you learn new skills and develop as an individual.

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

If you're looking for a role that is exciting, challenging and diverse in which you can form lasting business and personal relationships, apply for the Chaser Account Manager position today.

*How to apply*

In applying please answer the following questions:

# Why have you applied for this role?
# Talk us through your most recent/relevant role and your sales performance to date
# What is your proudest professional achievement and why? - ( Max 200 words)
# Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: Head of Customer Success
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We’re looking for a passionate, customer-focused leader who can build and own responsibility for our Success and Support processes. Our primary route to market is through accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will be responsible for the delivery of Partner Success to those partner accounting and bookkeeping firms to ensure they make the most out of the block licences we sell to them. You will also be responsible for the delivery of Customer Success to new direct trialists to ensure maximum conversion from free trial. You will own responsibility for both ongoing retention and expansion MRR.

We are growing at a fantastic rate. Success and support are absolutely integral to our growth. This is an incredible opportunity for someone talented and ambitious to make a huge impact.

You'll be reporting directly to the CEO. Our head office is located in Moorgate London. Over half our team work remotely and we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*Your Role Will Consist Of*

* Recruiting and managing a high performing success team. At the outset, this will be a team of two so you will still need to be very actively involved in delivery
* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will need to develop a deep empathy that can enable us to work with them to successfully introduce Chaser to their clients
* Crafting, delivering and refining training programmes for accounting and bookkeeping firm staff. This training will need to provide them with a detailed understanding of how Chaser as a product works. It will also need to equip them to identify opportunities and successfully sell and market Chaser to clients who could benefit from it
* Leading ongoing partner and customer account management to both avoid churn and maximise upsell opportunities for growth in their use of Chaser
* Delivering demonstrations of Chaser
* Management of all educational resources about Chaser, including inter alia our help centre and educational videos
* Ensuring partners and customers are aware of all new developments to the product and enabled to make the most out of them
* Creating and running webinars about Chaser
* Crafting, delivering and refining our Customer Success outreach and training process to new direct trialists so as to maximise trial conversion and retention
* Ensure that all customer and partner support is prompt and comprehensive. We pride ourselves on the quality of our support as a company
* Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Product and Engineering in carrying out these responsibilities; relaying feedback and insights as the voice of our partner and customer to shape our ongoing product roadmap
* Attending and representing Chaser at events

*About You*

* You will have a minimum of 3 years sales, success or account management experience. Experience of working in SaaS, with accounting firms or in credit control is a bonus
* You will have a deep passion for helping our customers and partners succeed
* You will be a proactive self-starter who is comfortable taking the initiative and solving problems autonomously
* You will be positive with an ability to engender the energy and excitement in partners and customers to use Chaser
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will love learning (fast!). You will be comfortable (well, as comfortable as it’s possible to be!) learning through trial and error
* You will have strong commercial and business acumen with an instinct for opportunity
* You don’t need to be an amateur netless tightrope walker, but you will be comfortable with the need to take risks in the role
* You will have excellent written communication skills
* You will have excellent spoken communication skills, both in person and over the phone. You will need to explain what are often complex technical matters in simple terms
* You will have strong time management and prioritisation skills. There will be lots of balls to juggle in this role
* You will be someone who thrives working in a high speed environment
* You will be excited about working as part of a small, tight-knit team
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an excellent understanding of how to best use Chaser as a product. Curiosity about how and why our product works will serve you well in this role

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

*How to apply*

In applying please answer the following questions:

# Why have you applied for this role? (Max 100 words)
# What is your proudest professional achievement and why? ( Max 200 words)
# What is a company or product that you think has excellent educational resources and/or support materials; and what makes them so good?
# What is the one resource (be that video, written, audio or any other medium) that you would recommend everyone in your Success team consume to help them do their jobs better; and why are you recommending it?
# Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: Senior QA Engineer/Manager
items.content:
OpenPlay is a digital platform operating in the UK, Ireland, UAE, Canada, Australia and Singapore that connects people to sports facilities and activities. It offers a search engine and a ‘nudge tool’ with curation based around user preferences, with quick easy online booking.

The core product is a comprehensive online booking system for venues and activity providers used to run all aspects of their business- see more at http://openplay.net

We are based in an amazing office in Clerkenwell, Central London with an informal, hard-working and kind team culture. The office is full of other innovative startups and there’s a real buzz in our working space.

The successful senior QA will be the first point of contact for all testing requirements. You will help shape our QA roadmap from seeing up Jira workflows/processes to managing junior QAs in the team.

Key Skills:

- Have worked in a structured environment with standard QA Procedures and Processes.

- Have experience of working in an environment encompassing the full life cycle of product development from defining and writing the technical specification through to release.

- Good working knowledge and experience in JIRA and related tools.

- Be capable of prioritising own workload and potentially others in a high pressured and time constrained environment.

- Have the ability to demonstrate skills in troubleshooting and 'thinking on your feet'.

- Experience testing large web applications and developing automation frameworks

- Experience managing one or more junior QAs

Location

The role would mainly be based from our offices in Clerkenwell but we do have flexibility for remote/ home working – we are a remote focused company so slack/Skype/trello etc are used in the majority of day to day interactions

items.content:
Summary
We are looking for a motivated and high-achieving Head of Hiring to join our team working on an exciting new Big Data/Machine Learning platform. This is a full time placement with significant opportunities for growth and advancement as one of the first employees of the company.

The Company
causaLens is high-tech startup based in London. We are bringing the next level of Automation, Automated Machine Learning and big data technologies to the World’s most sophisticated organizations. We are a fast-growing team and the founders have worked for some of the most prominent global hedge funds and scientific institutions.

Core requirements:
Previous experience with hiring preferred.
Technical background is a plus.
Ability to identify and evaluate candidates quickly and efficiently.
Ability to source candidates through online platforms and social media.
Interest on developing and constructing the hiring strategy.
Fluency in English required.

Roles and Responsibilities:
This is an exciting role for a smart, creative person to take point on the recruitment of top talent in a high tech, high-growth start-up.
If you are passionate about connecting top talent people with amazing job opportunities, this is the role for you!

Benefits:
Successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about innovation and making a difference. We will offer guidance, mentorship and opportunities for turbo-charged professional development, as the first employee in our HR department.
